newsitem.title: USA: Calif. Assembly OKs bill for levy repairs, ballpark.
newsitem.headline: Calif. Assembly OKs bill for levy repairs, ballpark.

text.p: California's state Assembly approved legislation on Monday that would speed levy repairs statewide and help San Francisco build a new ballpark, lawmakers said.
Senate Bill 181, by Senator Quentin Kopp, was approved by the state Assembly on a vote of 71-to-1. The bill now advances to the Senate, which could vote on the measure on Thursday.
The bill would provide targeted exemptions from the California Environmental Quality Act to speed flood-damage repairs in the state, lawmakers said.

The bill would provide similar exemptions to a proposed major league ballpark for the San Francisco Giants. Proponents of the bill said it would speed the ballpark construction timeline by three to four months.

Last year, San Francisco voters approved construction of the ballpark, which is scheduled to open in April of 2000. The ballpark will cost about $255 million to build. The financing package includes $10 million in tax increment financing by the San Francisco Redevelopment Agency.
